pages.title: The Genome
pages.text: Every crop holds an 8-letter $(6)Genome$() that dictates its behavior. You can view this using a $(l:modid:genetic_analyzer)Genetic Analyzer$(/l).$(br2)The genome is split into 4 pairs of letters (called $(o)Loci$()), each controlling a specific trait:$(br)$(li)$(2)Growth$() (Speed)$(li)$(6)Gain$() (Yield)$(li)$(b)Resistance$() (Weed/Pest Defense)$(li)$(d)Modifier$() (Mutation Rate)

pages.title: Understanding Alleles
pages.text: Each trait is controlled by two letters (Alleles), inherited from its parents. $(br2)Letters range from $(c)F$() (worst) up to $(6)S$() (best). There are also special hidden tiers like $(5)X$() and $(5)G$().$(br2)Capital letters are $(2)Dominant$(), while lowercase letters are $(4)Recessive$(). The combination of these letters determines not only the plant's stats, but its stability!
